授業目的:
Course Subtitle: Academic Writing B - Advanced Academic Thesis Writing
英文欄参照/Refer to the following
到達目標: 英文欄参照/Refer to the following
授業方法:
Depending on the evolving situation, course format may include the following:
- timed 5-minute writing
- lecture on scheduled topic
- class discussion on scheduled topic
- person-to-person consultations
You should have a stable wifi or internet connection at home to complete all out-of-class assignments.

第1回:
Weekly writing assignments can be expected, but all of them will be related to each student's research topic.
Needs Analysis Survey: 1 hour
第2回: The research proposal and finding literature
Assess progress with thesis development: 1-2 hours
第3回: Introducing a thesis model; table of contents formatting and contents
Prepare hypothetical table of contents for own thesis: 1-2 hours
第4回: The introduction chapter of a thesis
第5回: Using writing tools and avoiding plagiarism
Prepare research proposal for own thesis: 4-6 hours
第6回: Prepare and submit all components of hand-in assignment 1: 8-10 hours
第7回: The literature review chapter and submission 1 discussion
Prepare literature review chapter of thesis: 4-6 hours
第8回: Prepare methodology chapter of thesis: 4-6 hours
第9回: Prepare results and findings chapter of thesis: 4-6 hours
第10回: Prepare discussion chapter of thesis: 4-6 hours
第11回: Prepare conclusion chapter of thesis: 4-6 hours
第14回: Mock conference (call for papers, short presentation, Q&A)
Prepare final oral defense and presentation: 6-8 hours
トピック.授業外学習2: ** First-year graduate students who are considering this course but are still uncertain about their precise research topic and research methodology are strongly encouraged to take this course in their second year.

評価.教科書Required texts0:
Handouts and materials will be given in class by the instructor; however, purchase of the following books are OPTIONAL:

How to Write a Thesis, 4th edition (2017)
Rowena Murray
Open University Press, McGraw Hill

Publication Manual of the American Psychological Association, 7th edition (2019)
**only consider this if you're following APA style***
